###Arduino LED Cube
*Created By Chris P.*

This project is a cube of 64 LEDs that can be programmed to make all kinds of interesting animations and patterns! Its circuitry allows for LEDs to be individually addressed in the programming. 

I have made an HTML/PHP program that utilizes checkboxes to write Arduino compatible code to light up LEDs. This program saves time, and is also pretty neat!

I have also added a Joystick and two pushbuttons as input devices that can be used in any way. I personally am attempting to make Snake in 3D with the Joystick, but I hope to eventually publish this project as an open source kit.


###Bill of Materials
***
+ 3 packs of 25 diffused blue 3mm LEDs (75 LEDS, only 64 are used): https://www.adafruit.com/products/780
+ 25 150 Ohm Resistors, for current limiting the LEDs
+ 7 10k Ohm Resistors, to pull up the buttons and pull down the transistors
+ 2 pushbuttons
+ 2 2D Thumb Joysticks (1 used): https://www.sparkfun.com/products/9032?
+ 1 Rocker On/Off Switch, wired in line with the power supply
+ Arduino Mega
+ 9v Power Supply AC: https://www.adafruit.com/products/63
+ Really Big Protoboard: http://www.jameco.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/Product_10001_10001_206594_-1?CID=PDF
+ USB A to B cable


###System Operation Scheme
***
1. The Arduino applies power to a programmed number of anode columns (my pins are 23-38)
2. The Transistors grant ground to only one layer at a time

- The use of 4x4x4 3D arrays allows the Arduino to light up different LEDs in different layers
